body_html:
@gunan Do I have to change from CUDA 8 to 9 as well? Btw I am not using master I am using: commit: 397f04a (June 5, 2018). As told previously my system is little bit old and I could only make Bazel 0.11.1 work on it.

LSB Version:	:core-4.1-noarch:core-4.1-ppc64le
Distributor ID:	RedHatEnterpriseServer
Description:	Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 7.4 (Maipo)
Release:	7.4
Codename:	Maipo

NCCL 2 requires at least glibc 2.19 whereas I have glibc 2.17 however I did find
AWS providing something similar but it runs NCCL 2 with glibc 2.17 that's pretty odd to me.

body:
@gunan Do I have to change from CUDA 8 to 9 as well? Btw I am not using master I am using: commit: 397f04acb1faeff451691d7fdc0f754eeb547cc1 (June 5, 2018). As told previously my system is little bit old and I could only make Bazel 0.11.1 work on it. 
```
LSB Version:	:core-4.1-noarch:core-4.1-ppc64le
Distributor ID:	RedHatEnterpriseServer
Description:	Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 7.4 (Maipo)
Release:	7.4
Codename:	Maipo
```
NCCL 2 requires at least glibc 2.19 whereas I have glibc 2.17 however I did find 
[AWS](https://aws.amazon.com/marketplace/pp/B077GFM7L7) providing something similar but it runs NCCL 2 with glibc 2.17 that's pretty odd to me.
